intro: Stachyphrynium tetranthum, commonly known as the four-flowered stachyphrynium, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. It is often found in moist, forested areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
